data.title: Fixes iOS StorageDevice AOT compile problem
data.body:
StorageDevice now uses two separate delegates, rather than one with a Nullable<PlayerIndex> parameter.  MonoTouch's AOT doesn't seem to be able to cope with PlayerIndex?, so we do it manually.

Fixes #316

data.title: use latest 3rdparty libs submodule to pull in needed OpenTK.dll.config
add in skipping of a beginning bext section and fix skipping of non-data sections
data.body:
- don't ask me why the -1 is needed. it doesn't make sense.  20 + 602 = 622
  NOT 623 (which is that is happening w/o the -1)

this was required to get the "Blackjack" demo from the StarterKit working on linux

data.title: --help
Android Memory Leak
data.body: There's a massive memory leak when reloading textures after the context is lost.  It seems that when the application is put into the background, it doesn't lose any memory consumption.  But when returning and the opengl textures are recreated, the memory is added to the existing memory footprint.  Eventually, the application crashes because it's consumed to much memory.

data.title: Fixed the LzxDecoder  for the ContentManager,
data.body:
these still needs to be looked at because we are creating a new LzxDecoder each time we decompress an asset

Fixed the comment in the GraphicsDevice.cs

data.title: Followed Pre-Req guide and cannot compile.
data.body:
Hello all, let me first say I am new to github and MonoGame so pardon my ignorance. If it helps, I am here for MonoGame and thank you for all your hard work. So sorry if this doesn't belong in "issues"

I have summarized my issue on pastebin: http://pastebin.com/sur9L8Ky

My platform details: 
Windows 7 x64 with MonoDevelop 2.4

data.title: Fixes a problem with the viewport not being set correctly for render targets
data.body: As the title says :)

data.title: develop - Improves Guide.Begin|EndShowKeyboardInput behavior
data.body:
KeyboardInputAsyncResult, KeyboardInputView and KeyboardInputViewController all conspire to implement correct behavior for Guide.BeginShowKeyboardInput and Guide.EndShowKeyboardInput.

iOSGamePlatform now provides its UIViewController as service so the Guide class can use it to present KeyboardInputViewController.

iOSGameView_Touch can now properly distinguish between Tap and DoubleTap gestures.  UIGestureRecognizer.RequireGestureToFail was needed.

GamerServicesComponent no longer creates a LocalNetworkGamer in its constructor.  Doing so causes the sign-in dialog to eventually show any time GamerServicesComponent is added to a Game.  XNA doesn't do this.

data.title: Updates iOS SpriteBatch to respect matrices in Draw
data.body:
_This request was partially superseded by dellis1972's recent one_

Also adds tests to demonstrate this (which currently barely fail on iOS due to an existing rendering issue).

data.title: Lots of Changed for the Android Project . plus new MonoDevleop AddIns and Installer
data.body:
Trying to clean up they way the orientation stuff works for android it should be working like WP7.
Added code to support reading the ScreenOrientation from the ActivityAttribute, but have commented this out for now.
Fixed a memory leak in the ESTexture2D.cs for Android.
Added MonoDevelop project templates for Andoird / Windows and Linux.
Fix a bug where the _matrix is not applied properly should fix on both Android and iOS.

data.title: develop - Updates iOS SpriteBatch to respect matrices in Draw
data.body:
Also adds tests to demonstrate this (which currently barely fail on iOS due to an existing rendering issue).

This fixes issue #364

data.title: develop - Fixes iOS DoubleTap, improves touches in serial Game instances
data.body:
iOSGameView previously didn't distinguish between Tap and DoubleTap.
Now it does.  It also didn't synchronize with TouchPanel.EnabledGestures
if they had been set before the Game instance was created, and now it
does.

data.title: SpriteBatch.Draw not using specified transformation matrix
develop - Fixes iOS app startup in non-Portrait orientations
data.body:
Repairs #362

iOSGameViewController now does its best to divine the best frame rectangle for the view it manages.  iOSGamePlatform forces the current GraphicsDevice's Viewport to Window.ClientBounds in BeforeInitialize. This is not ideal.  GraphicsDevice itself should correctly query the view for its bounds, but the changes needed to support that are extensive and no doubt conflict significantly with develop3d.

data.title: iOS Won't Start In Landscape
data.body: Though rotation is now working correctly when iOS applications start in Portrait and are turned to other orientations, starting out in orientations that are not Portrait isn't working correctly in all cases.

data.title: develop - Tests upgrades
data.body:
Upgrades tests and improves compatibility between develop and develop3d (adds stubs for the Model class in develop).  This supersedes [pull 360](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/360), which I've now closed.

_From the original Tests commit_

Creating components for tests is no longer the preferred way to create
simple visual tests.  Instead, prefer Game.DrawWith, and the other *With
events exposed by TestGameBase.  Follow that with a call to
RunSingleFrameTest or RunMultiFrameTest.

Captured image folders and filenames are now automatically generated in
all cases.

Reduced the size of some reference images (that picture of outer space,
even when PNG compressed, was consuming quite a bit of space).

Reorganized reference image names to be more natural:
Clear/frame-01.png => Clear-1.png, for example.

Improved tests.xsl with better handling of parameterized tests and
generally better layout and display.

Adds a few tests for GraphicsDevice.Viewport for issue #329

data.title: develop - Updates Tests with drastic simplification changes
data.body:
_From the commit to MonoGame-Tests_

Creating components for tests is no longer the preffered way to create
simple visual tests.  Instead, prefer Game.DrawWith, and the other *With
events exposed by TestGameBase.  Follow that with a call to
RunSingleFrameTest or RunMultiFrameTest.

Captured image folders and filenames are now automatically generated in
all cases.

Reduced the size of some reference images (that picture of outer space,
even when PNG compressed, was consuming quite a bit of space).

Reorganized reference image names to be more natural:
Clear/frame-01.png => Clear-1.png, for example.

Improved tests.xsl with better handling of parameterized tests and
generally better layout and display.

Adds a few tests for GraphicsDevice.Viewport for issue #329

data.title: Changed fonts in AlienGame to allow it to run.
data.body: Changes in the StarterKits submodule.

data.title: Antialiasing Support (GraphicsDevice.PreferMultiSampling)
data.body: All platforms need to have antialiasing (re-?)enabled.  Pointers [here](http://www.gandogames.com/2010/07/tutorial-using-anti-aliasing-msaa-in-the-iphone/) and [here](https://devforums.apple.com/thread/45850).

data.title: develop - iOS Tests
data.body: Updates the Tests submodule with the needed commits for iOS testing, and improves the iOS platform to the point where the tests can be successfully executed.  For more details, see the individual commits.

data.title: develop3d - Ports ios_landscape changes from develop
data.body:
Improves iOS landscape support.

**Please don't pull this until I've learned how to compile and run with mojoshader on iOS!  This code has not been tested properly on that platform.**

data.title: Develop3d - Adding GLSLEffect files to Android and initial threaded loading support
data.body: Added Threading.cs which contains the smarts for supporting background loading.  To make a resource capable of background loading, wrap the bunch of GL code with Threading.Begin() and Threading.End(), preferably in a try..finally block to make sure Threading.End() is called.

data.title: Updates StarterKits submodule
data.body: Syncs StarterKits/ with @slygamer's changes that were just pulled into the MonoGame-StarterKits repo.

data.title: Add sleep for fixed time step in order to release the processor when fix...
data.body: ...ed time step is limiting the FPS.

data.title: Added first cut of the Android Project Templates for the 2.5 release for MonoDevelop
data.body: This is the MonoDevelop project templates for Android.
